paragraph.paragraph:
This sample shows you how to set up your first
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.html WEL_APPLICATION consisting of a single
/libraries/wel/reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.html WEL_FRAME_WINDOW . This is one of the simplest WEL applications you can write, and the output is shown below:
paragraph.heading: 2Compiling
paragraph.paragraph: To see compiling instructions, you have to enable javascript.
paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After you launch the sample, You should see the window displayed in the screen as illustrated above. You will have full control over the window, and the program will quit when you close the window.
paragraph.note: Note: The size and shape of the window may be different on your machine.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph:
Although this system does nothing except create and display a
/libraries/wel/reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.html WEL_FRAME_WINDOW , it shows how to set up your first
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.html WEL_APPLICATION .

This sample only contains one class,
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step1/root_cluster/tutorial_step1_chart.html TUTORIAL_STEP1 which inherits
/libraries/wel/reference/support/wel_application_chart.html WEL_APPLICATION and redefines main_window
